climbs.name: To Slab or Not to Slab

content.description:
Climb up and left and across a slab. Pull the crux moves over the roof down low, right of the deadfall tree. Continue with easy climbing angling up and left to the anchor on a ledge. This is a good route to access multi-pitch routes like

Slab Superstar

.
content.protection: 7 bolts plus a two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: It is the farthest left route in gully/base area.

content.description: You get more slab climbing on this one!
content.protection: 7 bolts plus a two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location:
It is the next route left of

Sands of Time

and its a "wavy gravy," right-facing corner system.

content.description: Climb slab and up and over a small roof.
content.protection: 7 bolts plus a bolted anchor at the top.
content.location:
It is the fifth route from the right but fourth line of bolts down low. Look for the wavy corner system for the next route to the left,

Sands of Time

, and this route is just right of it, climbing a small roof.

content.description: Climb a right-facing rounded corner for four bolts, and step right around roof. Climb a “wavy gravy” corner system where you can cut left at 3 different points.
content.protection: 7 bolts plus a bolted anchor at the top.
content.location: Look for the "wavy gravy," right-facing corner system.

content.description:
This route and the next route to the left,

The Ambiturner

, share a start. Climb the first three bolts, and then stay up and right, encountering a cruxy section near the top with crumbly rock.
content.protection: 7 bolts plus a bolted anchor at the top.
content.location:
It is the third route from the left, sharing a start with

The Ambiturner

.

content.description:
Start on

A Few Loose Cobbles

, but go straight up.
content.protection: 7 bolts plus a two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: It is the third route from the left but first line of bolts as the leftmost three routes share the same start. This route is the rightmost Y of those three routes that share a start.

content.description: An initial steep section leads to some big holes and a small roof that is bypassed on the right with some tricky slab climbing above before it eases up.
content.protection: 8 bolts plus a two bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: It is the fourth route from the left but only the second line of bolts down low (the leftmost three routes share a start).

content.description: Craters on the Moon has easy climbing on big holes (“craters”) to a slab crux at the fourth bolt and fun climbing on cobbles to the top. Start down and right from the main base area with a white streak at the bottom.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus a bolted anchor at the top.
content.location: It is the furthest route on the right.

content.description: Climb up and right staying left of the bush, following a faint overlap with conglomerates. This is mellow until pulling slabby crux at the fourth bolt to gain final headwall.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus a bolted anchor at the top.
content.location: It is the second route from the right.

content.description:
A male model who can also turn left is an Ambiturner, just like a climber who can take the left variation to

Righteous Babes on the Beach

. Climb the first three bolts of

Righteous Babes...

, and then go left into a shallow corner feature gained by going over a small overlap. At the top, you can go right to the anchor for

Righteous...

or you can go up and left, clipping one more bolt and go the anchor for

Shelter in Place

.
content.protection: 8 or 9 bolts plus a bolted anchor at the top.
content.location:
Start on the first three bolts shared with

Righteous Babes on the Beach

, and then go left.

content.description:
This is the original route. It was originally climbed with gear, but bolts were added later. It lies at the top of a gully area with the majority of routes and is a good route to access if you want to multi-pitch climb, continuing on

The OS

or

Coblin Valley

.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus a bolted anchor on the ledge.
content.location: It is the second route from the left but the first line of bolts as the leftmost routes share the start. This is the middle of those three that share a start.
